panels.title: Number of Virtual Machine By hour of Day

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns the hourly hosts
-- Max and Average Active VMs Counts

SELECT DISTINCT
    now() AS time,
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00') AS hour_num,
    AVG ( VMS ) AS "Avg. Number of VMs"
--    AVG ( VMS_Peak ) AS "Avg. VMs Peak"
FROM (
    -- Here we get the hosts Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
    SELECT
        history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                active_vms,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS VMS,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                max_active_vms,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS VMS_Peak
    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active hosts only
        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
        AND v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_id in ($host_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
    GROUP BY
        history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00')
ORDER BY
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00')  ASC

panels.title: Single Host Resource Usage - Average Number of Virtual Machine (BR2A)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns the hourly hosts
-- Max and Average Active VMs Counts

SELECT DISTINCT
    now() AS time,
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00') AS hour_num,
--    AVG ( VMS ) AS "Avg. Number of VMs",
    AVG ( VMS_Peak ) AS "Avg. VMs Peak"
FROM (
    -- Here we get the hosts Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
    SELECT
        history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                active_vms,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS VMS,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                max_active_vms,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS VMS_Peak
    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active hosts only
        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
        AND v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_id in ($host_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
    GROUP BY
        history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00')
ORDER BY
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00')  ASC

panels.title: Single Host Resource Usage - Number of Virtual Machines Peaks  (BR2A)
Host CPU Usage By hour of Day

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns the hourly hosts
-- Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks

SELECT DISTINCT
    now() AS time,
    -- Here we get the hour of day (HOUR) as a number.
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00') AS hour_num,
    AVG ( CPU_Usage ) AS CPU_Usage
--    AVG ( CPU_Peak ) AS CPU_Peak
FROM (
    -- Here we get the hosts Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
    SELECT
        history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                cpu_usage_percent,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS CPU_Usage,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                max_cpu_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS CPU_Peak
    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active hosts only
        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
        AND v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_id in ($host_id)
        AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
        AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
    GROUP BY
        history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00')
ORDER BY
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00') ASC

panels.title: Single Host Resource Usage - Average CPU Usage Peaks (BR2A)
Host Memory Usage By hour of Day

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT
    now() AS time,
    -- Here we get the hour of day ( HOUR ) AS a number.
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00') AS hour_num,
    AVG ( MEM_Usage ) AS "Memory Usage"
--    AVG ( MEM_Peak ) AS "Memory Usage Peaks"
FROM (
    -- Here we get the hosts Max and Average CPU Usage Peaks
    SELECT
        history_datetime AS time,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                memory_usage_percent,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS MEM_Usage,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                max_memory_usage,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) /
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                minutes_in_status,
                0
            )
        ) AS MEM_Peak
    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active hosts only
        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
        AND v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_id in ('cf46710e-e0ba-481e-8ef3-8302f06debde','366adc66-ad57-4994-8257-1a50870a8a3a','1ff0515e-fcc5-48b6-889a-6ea0b039ce61','1e111b5e-4c53-44ab-ba26-9999fafa967f','e1b0c668-f452-46ff-89f5-038e7c0e9d7b')
        AND history_datetime >= '2020-04-27T00:37:20.175Z'
        AND history_datetime < '2020-05-04T09:55:10.369Z'
    GROUP BY
        history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
        to_char(time, 'HH24:00')
ORDER BY
        to_char(time, 'HH24:00') ASC

        -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user

panels.title: Single Host Resource Usage - Memory Usage Peaks (BR2A)
Host Interfatce Rx and Tx Usage By hour of Day

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns top 3 busiest
-- Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates, by hour of day

SELECT DISTINCT
    now() AS time,
    -- Here we get the hour of day ( HOUR ) AS a number.
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00')
    AS hour_num,
 --   AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS Rx_rate,
    AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS Tx_rate
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
            ELSE
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                ||
                '*'
        END AS interface_name,
        statistics.history_datetime AS time,
        AVG (
            COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 )
        ) AS Rx_rate,
        AVG (
            COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 )
        ) AS Tx_rate
    FROM
        v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
        AS statistics
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                statistics.host_interface_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id in ('cf46710e-e0ba-481e-8ef3-8302f06debde','366adc66-ad57-4994-8257-1a50870a8a3a','1ff0515e-fcc5-48b6-889a-6ea0b039ce61','1e111b5e-4c53-44ab-ba26-9999fafa967f','e1b0c668-f452-46ff-89f5-038e7c0e9d7b')
        AND history_datetime >= '2020-04-25T06:40:36.491Z'
        AND history_datetime < '2020-05-25T06:40:36.491Z'
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
            GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
        )
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id IN (
            SELECT c.host_interface_id
            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly b
                INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                    ON (
                        c.host_interface_id = b.host_interface_id
                    )
                INNER JOIN v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                    ON (
                        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime =
                        b.history_datetime AND
                        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_id in ('cf46710e-e0ba-481e-8ef3-8302f06debde','366adc66-ad57-4994-8257-1a50870a8a3a','1ff0515e-fcc5-48b6-889a-6ea0b039ce61','1e111b5e-4c53-44ab-ba26-9999fafa967f','e1b0c668-f452-46ff-89f5-038e7c0e9d7b')
                    )
            WHERE
                -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_status = 1
                AND c.host_id in ('cf46710e-e0ba-481e-8ef3-8302f06debde','366adc66-ad57-4994-8257-1a50870a8a3a','1ff0515e-fcc5-48b6-889a-6ea0b039ce61','1e111b5e-4c53-44ab-ba26-9999fafa967f','e1b0c668-f452-46ff-89f5-038e7c0e9d7b')
                AND b.history_datetime >= '2020-04-25T06:40:36.491Z'
                AND b.history_datetime < '2020-05-25T06:40:36.491Z'
                AND c.history_id IN (
                    SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                    GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                )
                -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                AND
                  CASE
                    WHEN 'No'='Yes'
                      THEN 1=1
                    WHEN 'No'='No'
                      THEN delete_date isnull
                  END
            GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
            ORDER BY
                AVG (
                    COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 )
                ) +
                AVG (
                    COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 )
                ) DESC
            LIMIT 3
        )
        -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
        -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
        AND
          CASE
            WHEN 'No'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
            WHEN 'No'='No'
              THEN delete_date isnull
          END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
        interface_name,
        statistics.history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00')
ORDER BY
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00')

panels.title: Single Host Resource Usage - Interface Transmit Rate Usage (BR2A)

panels.description: This report contains charts displaying resources usage measurements (Number of Virtual Machines, CPU, Memory, Network Tx/Rx) for a selected host over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2C - This query returns top 3 busiest
-- Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates, by hour of day

SELECT DISTINCT
    now() AS time,
    -- Here we get the hour of day ( HOUR ) AS a number.
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00')
    AS hour_num,
    AVG ( Rx_rate ) AS Rx_rate
--    AVG ( Tx_rate ) AS Tx_rate
FROM (
    SELECT
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN
                    v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
            ELSE
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                ||
                '*'
        END AS interface_name,
        statistics.history_datetime AS time,
        AVG (
            COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 )
        ) AS Rx_rate,
        AVG (
            COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 )
        ) AS Tx_rate
    FROM
        v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
        AS statistics
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                statistics.host_interface_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id in ('cf46710e-e0ba-481e-8ef3-8302f06debde','366adc66-ad57-4994-8257-1a50870a8a3a','1ff0515e-fcc5-48b6-889a-6ea0b039ce61','1e111b5e-4c53-44ab-ba26-9999fafa967f','e1b0c668-f452-46ff-89f5-038e7c0e9d7b')
        AND history_datetime >= '2020-04-25T06:40:36.491Z'
        AND history_datetime < '2020-05-25T06:40:36.491Z'
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id IN (
            SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
            FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
            GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
        )
        AND v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id IN (
            SELECT c.host_interface_id
            FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly b
                INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                    ON (
                        c.host_interface_id = b.host_interface_id
                    )
                INNER JOIN v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                    ON (
                        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.history_datetime =
                        b.history_datetime AND
                        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_id in ('cf46710e-e0ba-481e-8ef3-8302f06debde','366adc66-ad57-4994-8257-1a50870a8a3a','1ff0515e-fcc5-48b6-889a-6ea0b039ce61','1e111b5e-4c53-44ab-ba26-9999fafa967f','e1b0c668-f452-46ff-89f5-038e7c0e9d7b')
                    )
            WHERE
                -- Here we filter by active hosts only
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly.host_status = 1
                AND c.host_id in ('cf46710e-e0ba-481e-8ef3-8302f06debde','366adc66-ad57-4994-8257-1a50870a8a3a','1ff0515e-fcc5-48b6-889a-6ea0b039ce61','1e111b5e-4c53-44ab-ba26-9999fafa967f','e1b0c668-f452-46ff-89f5-038e7c0e9d7b')
                AND b.history_datetime >= '2020-04-25T06:40:36.491Z'
                AND b.history_datetime < '2020-05-25T06:40:36.491Z'
                AND c.history_id IN (
                    SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                    FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                    GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                )
                -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
                -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
                AND
                  CASE
                    WHEN 'No'='Yes'
                      THEN 1=1
                    WHEN 'No'='No'
                      THEN delete_date isnull
                  END
            GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
            ORDER BY
                AVG (
                    COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 )
                ) +
                AVG (
                    COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 )
                ) DESC
            LIMIT 3
        )
        -- Here we get or remove deleted VM devices according to what the user chose
        -- in the "show_deleted" parameter
        AND
          CASE
            WHEN 'No'='Yes'
              THEN 1=1
            WHEN 'No'='No'
              THEN delete_date isnull
          END
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
        interface_name,
        statistics.history_datetime
) AS a
GROUP BY
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00')
ORDER BY
    to_char(time, 'HH24:00')

panels.title: Single Host Resource Usage - Interface Receive Usage Percent (BR2A)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters
list.label: Data Center
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text , datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters WHERE datacenter_id IN  ('$datacenter_id')
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cluster_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters WHERE datacenter_id IN  ('$datacenter_id')

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT host_name AS __text , host_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts WHERE cluster_id IN ('$cluster_id')
list.label: Host
list.name: host_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT host_name AS __text , host_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_hosts WHERE cluster_id IN ('$cluster_id')
